channel.title: Comments on: MySQL Cluster: The Latest Developments in Management, Free webinar
channel.description: Database technologies - especially around scalability and High Availability

item.title: By: andrew
item.dc:creator: andrew
item.description:
In reply to <a href="./../mysql-cluster-the-latest-developments-in-management-free-webinar/index.html#comment-64965">Zainal Abidin</a>.
Hi Zainal,
you just connect your mysql client or connector to any of the MySQL Servers that are part of the Cluster - they can all see all of the data.
Andrew.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Zainal Abidin.

Hi Zainal,

you just connect your mysql client or connector to any of the MySQL Servers that are part of the Cluster – they can all see all of the data.

Andrew.

item.title: By: Zainal Abidin
item.dc:creator: Zainal Abidin
item.description:
I'm not familiar MySQL Cluster. Now i confuse. How does application connect to mysql cluster db? Using what? Example: If Oracle RAC, application connect using listener. How about MySQL Cluster? Care to explain.
Thanks.
item.content:encoded:
I’m not familiar MySQL Cluster. Now i confuse. How does application connect to mysql cluster db? Using what? Example: If Oracle RAC, application connect using listener. How about MySQL Cluster? Care to explain.

Thanks.
